editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: Fols. iii-vi blank. On viv is a table of contents, s. xiii ex. After art. 6 it adds ‘Aristoteles de [erased]’, Burley on De Longitudine et Brevitate Vitae and De Sensu et Sensato, and a ‘liber de compendiis numerorum’.

physDesc.p: Three or four separate books, together by s. xiv. I-III are physically similar and it is hard to imagine that they were ever separate; yet the last leaf of I was clearly next to or pasted to a cover; perhaps I originally followed II and III.

supportDesc.extent:
119 leaves (vi + 114) 220 160
The edges retrimmed, affecting marginalia, and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A4 / 112 / 2–512, 66 / 74(1 canc.; 2–3 half-leaves), a bifolium / 88, 9–1010, 118, 128(6–8 canc.). II has pencilled quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form; III has red leaf-numbering; the quires of IV are numbered at the end.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. fols. i-ii and 113–14 are paper binding leaves; on f. 113 is a partial transcription of the note on f. 112v. f. iii was a pastedown in an earlier binding. f. 12 was possibly a pastedown in an earlier binding sewn on four bands, and has rust-marks from furniture of uncertain form.

provenance.p:
On f. 112v are notes of s. xiv on studies and lectures at Oxford, pr. Powicke, p. 34 n.: Nota quod hec est forma inceptorum in artibus.
In primis iiior libri Metheorum
Item iiiior de Celo et Mundo
Item quartus Topicorum Boycii a Marchal
Item Algarismus inicium a Payn
Item Compotus cum Spera
Item Aritmetica cum Gemetria
Item x. libri Eticorum
Item xii. libri de Animalibus
Item x. libri Methaphysice 2 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 11 12 a Play. Memorandum quod I. T. audiuit librum De Sompno et Vigilia et librum De Memoria et Reminiscentia a m. suo magistro N. K. postquam gratia fuit impetrata quod quilibet istorum duorum librorum staret pro quocunque libro sue forme uoluntarie. Item librum de Inspiracione et Respiracione. Item librum de Sensu et Sensato. Item librum De Motu Animalium.

(In a later hand, over er. Viue Deo gratus toto mundo tumulatus
Crimine mundatus semper transire paratus.)
Memorandum quod habui a Bokynham xii. dies in gemetria et totalem literam 2i libri geometrie et a Wescot ix. dies in gemetria.
Item a Bokenham literam totalem primi libri Arsmetrice et xii. dies Arsmetrice. Item a Hobul in’.

It is remarkable that none of the persons named can be securely identified. ‘Bokenham’ was perhaps the theologian Thomas Buckingham (BRUO 298–9), fellow of Merton in 1324, until 1340. In that case, ‘Westcot’ cannot have been John Westcote (BRUO 2021–2), fellow of New College in 1380, d. by June 1418. On f. viv is ‘liber collegii’, in the large humanistica used for the inscriptions associated with Thomas Bloxham, ‘Merton’ Oxon’’ added, s. xvii.

history.provenance: Inside the front board is the College bookplate and the modern shelf-mark ‘P. 4. 12’ in pencil, canc., and replaced with ‘C. 2. 12. (CCLXI)’ in red. At the head of f. viv is ‘8’, s. xvii. ‘12’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 103; Powicke, no. 990; Watson, Dated and Datable Oxford, no. 842 and pl. 143.

msItem.author: JOHN HOLYWOOD
msItem.title: Algorismus
msItem.incipit: Omnia que a primeua rerum origine precesserunt ratione numerorum formata sunt
msItem.explicit: tam in numeris quadratis quam cubicis.
msItem.note: Ed. F. S. Pedersen, Petri Philomenae de Dacia et Petri de S. Audemaro Opera Quadrivialia 1 (Corpus Philosophorum Danicorum Medii Aevi 10. 1–2: Copenhagen, 1983), pp. 174–201; eTK 0991A; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 306.
At the foot of fols. 1v-2 are verses, s. xv, cropped by the binder, ‘A numero numerum si sit tibi demere cura’.

msItem.author: JOHN HOLYWOOD
msItem.title: De Sphaera
msItem.incipit: Tractatum de spera in 4. partes distinguimus
msItem.note: Ed. L. Thorndike (Chicago, 1949), pp. 76–117; eTK 1524E, 1577L; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 306.
Followed by a short note: ‘Nota in fine quod idem est cuspis centrum et metullium’.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 38–41 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red or blue initials, rarely flourished in the other colour; red or blue paraphs.

msItem.author: ARNULF OF PROVENCE
msItem.title: Diuisio Scientiarum
msItem.incipit: Sicut scribitur ab Algazele decima sentencia proprietatum cause prime primus est largissimus
msItem.explicit: omnia ista requiruntur hec ad presens sufficiant.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit diuisio scientiarum omnium tam mecanicarum quam liberalium data a magistro Arnulfo Prouinciali qui rexit Parisius egregie.

msItem.author: ROBERT KILWARDBY OP
msItem.title: De ortu et diuisione scientiarum
msItem.incipit: Scientiarum alia est diuina alia humana
msItem.note: Ed. A. G. Judy (Auctores Britannici Medii Aevi 4: London, 1976); eTK 1404E; Glorieux, Arts 411y; Kaeppeli 3516.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 38–41 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Anglicana formata, perhaps the same hand as in part III.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red or blue initials, rarely flourished in the other colour; red or blue paraphs.

msItem.title: De diuisione philosophiae
msItem.incipit: Cum summum in uita solacium sit sapiencie studium

msItem.note: Anonymous. On f. 71v are pen-trials of s. xiv.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 38–41 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Anglicana formata, perhaps the same hand as in part II.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red or blue initials, rarely flourished in the other colour; red or blue paraphs.

msItem.author: ?GERARD OF NOGENT
msItem.title: Glossulae super Veterem Logicam
msItem.incipit: Secundum quod uult Agazel in metaphysica sua scientia corrigit uicia anime
Ad librum Porphirii accedamus qui pre maioribus est exprimendus. Iste liber cuius subiectum est uniuersale probabile diuiditur in duas partes
(Praed. f. 76v) Equiuoca dicuntur. Sicut dicit Boetius iste liber est de decem uocibus
(Perih. f. 97v) Primum oportet constituere. Sicut dicit philosophus in tertio de anima triplex est operatio intellectus
msItem.explicit: ergo contrarie non possunt similiter esse uniuerse.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt sentencie supra ueterem logicam. Actum anno Domini M. CC. nonagesimo, iii. die Veneris post Trinitatem Domini.
msItem.note: Glorieux, Théol. 70x; Lohr, p. 163 (this copy as Porph. only, and giving a different explicit to Perih.).

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 43–9 lines

handDesc.handNote: The scribe writing a small gothic rotunda bookhand, apparently finished in 1293, if he was not copying the date from his exemplar.
